Getting involved here means you are truly involved in making something special.
Who Is Involved?
The director and producer of this production is Jordan Friedman, who previously put up Proof at The Bridge Theatre, and has worked with a variety of New York City theatre companies. For this production he is producing and directing this independently without the financial assistance of another company. In addition, actors, designers and other hard-working production staff will come together, and all of them will benefit greatly from your assistance.

Cast:Lil' Bit: *Crawford M. CollinsUncle Peck: David M. FarringtonFemale Greek Chorus: Mary McNultyMale Greek Chorus: Stephen PowellFemale Greek Chorus: *Hannah Dubner*Appearing courtesy of Actors Equity Association. Staff:Director: Jordan FriedmanScenic Designer: Young JuangLighting Designer: Mitch OstCostume Designer: Johanna PanSound Designer: Jake WilliamsWhy This Show?
How I Learned To Drive is a play with a dynamic and compelling story that takes many unconventional directions and risks with its structure, and such structure presents a complex but worthwhile challenge to stage for an audience. Plays such as this that can balance both hilarious comedy and heartbreaking tragedy give theatregoers an experience that will be remembered. In addition, this is a timeless piece that was enjoyed by audience members 20 years ago, and will be enjoyed 20 years in the future.
How Can You Help?
Donating directly to this campaign will be greatly appreciated and will ensure that every person involved in the show can do their jobs to the best of their ability. With the exception of IndieGogo's fees, all of the funds rasied through this campaign will go directly towards the various production costs of putting on independent theatre in New York City, as well as ensuring that every person who works on the production can get the compensation they deserve.
What Is The Money Being Used For?
The funds will help to offset the production costs of How I Learned To Drive. This includes:*Renting the performance venue and rehearsal spaces.
*Providing the designers the budget they need to create the world of the play.
*Compensating everybody involved in the production as much as possible to ensure that all of their hard work gets rewarded.
*Various fees, including securing the rights, union paperwork and marketing the show.
Last Thoughts:
This production already does matter to many people, and the intent is for it to matter to many more. Anything you can provide to help this production grow and reach out is valued beyond what words can say.

story:
Short Summary

Norwich Theater Company Inc is a Community Theater Company dedicated to providing quality live theater entertainment to the Greater Norwich, New York Area. We are a 501 (c)(3) charitable organization in our third year of operation.

We have succeeded to the point where we are planning a full season of productions for our 2013-2014 season comprised of three full length stage productions: "A Christmas Carol", "Rehearsal for Murder", "Joseph and The Amazing Technicolor Dream Coat" and a kids theater camp featuring  "The Jungle Book" or a similar show. Our challenge is raising the funds needed to pay the royalties and obtain the production rights for these shows well in advance of the production dates themselves. Contributors to this project will help us build the foundation for quality live theater in our area for years to come and support theater education among area youth. Please join us to provide this opportunity to the next generation.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $5000 from this campaign to pay the Production costs and Royalty fees for the 4 shows we have planned for the 2013-2014 season:

"A Christmas Carol" $510

"Rehearsal for Murder" $495

"Jungle Book" $1580

"Joseph and The Amazing Technicolor Dream Coat" $2415

Backers at the various levels will receive Norwich Theater Company merchandise as a special thank-you for your support; use it with pride as a supporter of the NTCI 2013-2014 season.

All donated funds [regardless of amount raised] will be used to meet the cost of producing these shows.


The Impact

By supporting this campaign you can help provide quality stage entertainment in a climate of growing electronic media and economic challenge. Children and adults alike will be able to participate in the magic of live theater entertainment. Your support will allow us to keep ticket prices low and affordable; there-by opening the world of live theater to those that may not otherwise be able to participate.

As the economic climate continues to erode arts education in schools, community theater becomes more and more the only opportunity for youth to learn about and experience live performances.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for considering our campaign. We understand if you are not able to contribute at this time. However, your assistance is still needed. Please spread the word about our campaign and use the Indiegogo share tools. You can also visit our website and spread the word about our Company and productions.

story:
Short Summary

Please help us get to Scotland for the Fringe Fest !  Help build the next Rock of Ages! 

This story came to me in a dream, it was as if Janis Joplin wanted this version to be written.  Her STORY TOLD THROUGH her SPIRIT that comes back to earth in 2013.  Sophie B. Hawkins is Joplin's SPIRIT and brings us through different stories and musings about past and present- we let you into an artist's troubled soul, the intelligent woman who staved off bullying, was called  'the Ugliest Man' and became something against all odds throught her spirit.

It is important that 'art' gets made no matter how much the big machine tries to squash and homogonize it.  We have a voice and have survived the threats by a bigger more corporate 'feel good' version of Janis and like David facing Goliath.  We opened in LA to get good reviews and standing ovations in a little 99 seat theater and extended 3 months.  Every actor in this show is here because their heart, passion and belief in Room 105, something that is tryng to tell the truth and unite us all.  Through the understanding of another's pain we get to see/feel/know our own and triumph.  The big guns are still trying to stop the 'grass roots' version by blocking the licensing of songs etc... and if we can get to the Fringe Fest we can have a life in Europe and the World.  It's like when Janis got out of her small town to San Francisco- we are coming to Europe - Janis flousrished leaving Port Arthur and touch peoples lives.  We want to touch you.  We want that chance to grow and are going to the people like Janis did.  We are a show FOR the people, produced by the people.

What We Need & What You Get

All monies raised by you will be used to get airline tickets $14,610.70, housing, food and pay and feed actors and dancers which exceeds $30,000.00 for 30 days!  It is expensive!  Plus we have to license songs, pay insurance as well as legal fees, build the sets and pay musicians to play 27 dates at the Fringe Fest in Scotland, which is like Sundance film festival where all of Europe comes to book shows. If we get good reviews we can go onto the West End and the rest of Europe!!

We are offering different perks for donations in acting, dancing and singing lessons.  If you are able to give a large donation, we will bring you to Scotland to see the show and hang with us post-show one evening!  Be backstage and see rehearsal, and have a lunch with our star Sophie B Hawkins.  We want every contributor whether you donate 1.00 or 100,000 to have their names on a link on our website since this play will be produced by the people!

We need to reach our goal- sending 14 people to Scotland for 30 days and that is 100,000.  We have 20,000 so far!   That will cover everyone at a bare minimum.  Scotland is expensive and we have 14 people to house and feed. We don't want to leave any actor behind.  WE ARE FAMILY!

The Impact

If we make this goal then we will be a musical that is produced BY THE PEOPLE!  It will show what a group of believers can do. Just think a play produced by The People!

The impact on art will be huge and show art does survive and can beat the corporate machine!  Look how Rock of Ages did! ...Even Joplin's friends who knew her came and said we are the best play about her.  We have stories in this play from Janis's lovers and friends that no one has known before...

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money we would appreciate your time contribution!  If you live in Scotland you could drive us from airport to where we stay or better yet find a cheap place. Or put us on facebook, raise us money, get the word out, be a street team.....please help us.

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Ross Wade, and on April 27th and 28th of 2012, my musical for young audiences, SCHEME OF THE SUPER BULLIES, will be presented as part of The New York Childrenâ€™s Theater Festival at the Marjorie S. Deane Little Theater.

 

I originally wrote the play for a childrenâ€™s theater class I taught. I began the class by sitting the students in a circle and asking them, "If you could play any kind of character in the world, what would you be?" Over the next three months we did theater games, improv scenes, they even wrote and performed one-act plays starring their characters.

 

When rehearsals began, I brought in new pages each week and made revisions based on their feedback. The class culminated in a workshop production of SCHEME OF THE SUPER BULLIES, a full-length, original musical comedy inspired by their ideas.

 

The story takes place at Scarlett Pimpernel Elementary School. If Metropolis or Gotham City were grade schools, this is what theyâ€™d be like. So, instead of regular bullies, they have super bullies and superheroes. Their names and powers are all based on playground games, like Princess Dodgeball, Countess von Cooties, Eye Spy, Freeze Tag, The Jinx, and Rock Paper Scissors.


In August, SCHEME OF THE SUPER BULLIES won the 2011 Jackie White Memorial Play Writing Contest, placing first.

The Impact

This is a musical about the importance of working together. I came up with the theme when I noticed some students were struggling to share the stage during improv scenes. I wanted to make the musical's message relevant to both the performers and their audience. And really, working together is what theater's all about. Without a cast and crew, without an audience, there is no theater. Together we create and share an experience we could never accomplish alone.


It's my hope that, by seeing this musical, children will learn just how much we can do when we work as a team. Bullying serves only to hurt and divide, and the only way to stop it is to stand united against it. In school, it's easy to feel pressured into acting in ways we normally wouldn't, which is why being yourself is a central theme as well. Also, on a more personal note, I would love to give my students the opportunity to see the characters they originated brought to life by adult performers in a full-scale production. 

What We Need & What You Get

So, Iâ€™m asking you to become part of our team. This is a huge opportunity. Weâ€™re one of only three shows chosen. Itâ€™s my New York City debut. The festival provides a venue, but everything else is up to us. That means every part of this production; cast and crew, music, lighting, sets, costumes, props, rehearsal space, everything depends on your donations. We need to raise $6,500 in the next month. And every little bit helps.

 

$10 buys a script for a cast member. $60 buys an evening of rehearsal. $200 will buy costumes for half the characters in the show. Anything you give will help us produce SCHEME OF THE SUPER BULLIES and spread its positive messages about working together, being yourself, and standing united against bullying.

 

There are also some really excellent perks. Everything from a thank you e-mail written by the play's colorful characters to complimentary tickets! They've all been devised to sincerely express just how meaningful your contributions really are.

Other Ways You Can Help

The other thing you can do is get the word out! Tell your friends! Tell them on Facebook and Twitter and that hot new social networking thingy I haven't heard of yet. Tell strangers! Heck, tell your eccentric zillionaire uncle, too! We want to get the word out as far as it'll go about the production and this fundraising campaign.


Also, come see it! SCHEME OF THE SUPER BULLIES is performing on Friday, April 27th at 5:30pm and on Saturday, April 28th at 11am and 2pm. And tickets are already available! You can get them here. Then, after you've seen it, you can hop back on your Facebook or Twitter or whatever and tell everyone how much you loved it and how they should see it too!


As a team no dream is impossible. Thank you for reading, and I really hope you'll support us.

story:
Lilianna would love to be able to accept her invitation to attend IMTA: International Models & Talent Association, a convention held in July in New York City

Lilianna is a 9 year old vivacious, spunky, outgoing little girl who would love to have the chance to be discovered for opportunities in modeling and acting and IMTA is just the place to get that start! 

Lilianna has acted in various plays in child roles at her local high school as well as performing in her elementary school's choir. Last year she even had a solo with the school's Apple Chorus! 

Lilianna has also competed in pageants. Last year was her first year of competition and she placed 18th in her first pageant  and was the Second Runner Up in her second pageant! Lilianna also placed 6th in the Acting competition and 8th in the modeling competion of that first pageant. 

She recently completed an 8 week program in  acting & modeling with John Robert Powers in Philadelphia where she was extended this unique opportunity. 

Particpating at IMTA will give Lilianna exposure to hundreds of the best and well recognized agents and talent scouts not just from NYC or LA but globally from places like France, Italy, and more!

BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP TO GET TO IMTA!

We need to raise the total cost of the trip to IMTA which is $6,000. This total covers entry fees, hotel and transportation expenses, for both Lilianna and her mother. 

Your contribution will mean a lot to Lilianna and and I! 

I am a hard working single mother with 2 jobs. I do everything I can to provide a good life for myself and my daughter and do what I can to positively encourage her dreams and support her goals. Lilianna is very outgoing and has participated in both indoor and outdoor soccer, softball (helping her team reach 2nd place!), gymnastics, yoga, and most recently tap dancing. 

Please help make this opportunity a reality for Lilianna! 

I've added a couple perks so far but will be adding more when I can think of some cool stuff that people might be interested in! 

 

For More Information about IMTA visit http://www.imta.com/

story:
Hi, we are - Bryon Carr a dance media artist and Jackie Moynahan a dance & performance artist both of us have been creating & perform our work in NYC.  Triskelion Arts Presents is producing our first collaboration – “A Network of Intimate Domains”, this May 30th, 31st and June 1st.

We are both really excited about this opportunity and that the lovely and talented Abby Bender, Kimberly Goss and Meghan Schardt will be performing with us!!

Being “produced” means that Triskelion Arts provides the theater space for the run of the show, an amazing lighting designer, box office and marketing, which is a ton!  However, we still need to cover the rest of the costs to make the show a fantastic experience for the audience. That’s where you come in! Help us meet our goal of $2,000. 

What does it pay for?  Well here is our budget:

Rehearsal Space             $700

Props & Supplies             $300

Costumes                       $500

Performer Fees               $500

Total                           $2,000

 

We also have come up with some pretty fantastic perks for you! 

Everyone who donates $10 or more receives a personal Thank You card and your name will be mentioned in the program. Donate $25 and we’ll send you an 8x11 performance photo signed by the artists; $50 and you also get a DVD of the performance; $75 donors will receive a one of a kind clay sculpture by Jackie; donate $100 and you get personally designed T-Shirt by Bryon!  If you love us so much and your pockets are extra deep, donations of $300 or more get to have dinner with Jackie & Bryon.

Can’t donate - help us spread the word about our campaign and the show!! www.triskelionarts.org/bryon-carr-jackie-moynahan

Our goal is $2,000, every dollar raised will go directly towards making this show the creative success we envision.  With your help we can meet and succeed our goal.

Thank you in advance for you support

Cheers!

Jackie & Bryon

 

Websites:

Bryon Carr: carrdancemedia.com

Jackie Moynahan: jaxdance.com

Note: Jackie’s video clip is courtesy of GreenKat Production.

story:
Help Keep the Riverside Drive In Theater Open!

After nearly 100 years of showing 35mm motion picture film in movie theaters, the film industry is now undergoing a mammoth change to a new format.  Studios and distributors are now making the switch to DCP, or Digital Cinema Package, a file format that is screened at theaters via a high end digital projector and server.  Movie theaters need to invest up to $100,000 per screen to convert to this new systerm.  Up to 60% of U.S. movie theaters have reportedly already made the conversion, with the bulk of those being larger corporate multiplex theaters.  The remaining 40% includes many of the smaller historic neighborhood cinemas across the country that can't afford the high cost of the switch, a good number of which have already been forced to close their doors forever. 

The Riverside Drive In Theater is part of this 40% and faces the biggest challenge of its 8 year history. The theater must go digital or go dark. 

Since the Drive In opened we have had a growing attendance of "faithful" followers.  We have done many events for our local scouts and church groups.  We host a Special Event now twice a year, April Ghouls Monster-Rama and Super Drive In Monster-Rama.  These events bring many folks from all over the world!!

The Riverside Drive In Theater needs to raise $70,000 to make the film-to-digital conversion in 2013. We now launch this Indiegogo campaign to raise the $70,000 as all other options have been exhausted.  The main reason for this is that we are a profit business and there are no programs available to help us that we have qualified for.  If every one of our Facebook fans gave just $25 we'd hit our goal and help keep the Riverside Drive In Theater open.  Please donate to our campaign today - and share and repost with your family and friends too.  Thank you!
story_txt:
Help Keep the Riverside Drive In Theater Open!
After nearly 100 years of showing 35mm motion picture film in movie theaters, the film industry is now undergoing a mammoth change to a new format.  Studios and distributors are now making the switch to DCP, or Digital Cinema Package, a file format that is screened at theaters via a high end digital projector and server.  Movie theaters need to invest up to $100,000 per screen to convert to this new systerm.  Up to 60% of U.S. movie theaters have reportedly already made the conversion, with the bulk of those being larger corporate multiplex theaters.  The remaining 40% includes many of the smaller historic neighborhood cinemas across the country that can't afford the high cost of the switch, a good number of which have already been forced to close their doors forever. 
The Riverside Drive In Theater is part of this 40% and faces the biggest challenge of its 8 year history. The theater must go digital or go dark. 
Since the Drive In opened we have had a growing attendance of "faithful" followers.  We have done many events for our local scouts and church groups.  We host a Special Event now twice a year, April Ghouls Monster-Rama and Super Drive In Monster-Rama.  These events bring many folks from all over the world!!
The Riverside Drive In Theater needs to raise $70,000 to make the film-to-digital conversion in 2013. We now launch this Indiegogo campaign to raise the $70,000 as all other options have been exhausted.  The main reason for this is that we are a profit business and there are no programs available to help us that we have qualified for.  If every one of our Facebook fans gave just $25 we'd hit our goal and help keep the Riverside Drive In Theater open.  Please donate to our campaign today - and share and repost with your family and friends too.  Thank you!

story:
Why We're Storming the Palace

Hola! We're People's Theatre Project, a grassroots arts organization of artists, activists, educators, and community members of all ages in the Washington Heights neighborhood of northern Manhattan.  For the last 5 years, we have been working together to create and perform original plays about the things in our lives we care about - like immigration, bullying, education access, and children's health. Our vision is to make our NYC neighborhood a model for community building through the arts. Our next step toward realizing this dream is to bring together the community artists from each of our school and community-based groups for one mind blowing evening of original theatre created by kids, teens and adults in our community's very own world-class 3,300 seat venue: The United Palace of Cultural Arts! We're calling it THE PEOPLE STORM THE  PALACE!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $50,000 to make it possible for our team of teaching artists to spend more time in the rehearsal rooms playing, creating, and rehearsing with each of our groups of actors to prepare for the big event in June 2014. This season, we will also launch a tour of one of our plays to other working class and immigrant communities around New York City. Your contribution will go towards paying our artists, renting rehearsal and performance space, building sets and props, printing event programs, transporting actors around the city and getting the word out about our events - all the ingredients we need to bring theatre to the people and bring the people to the theater. When you join our campaign, you will receive perks like premium seating at the THE PEOPLE STORM THE PALACE event, a limited edition tote bag, and a group hug from 200 community artists on the stage of the United Palace. Muchisimas Gracias!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, you can still be a big help:
  • Do what you can to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Attend one of our events or act in one of our plays
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Follow us on Twitter
  • Visit our Website to learn more about us

story:
Who We Are:

About the Artist
Aaron Calafato is a performing artist and activist who creates solo-theater for social change. Aaron is a recent recipient of a 2012 Emerging Artist Grant from The Puffin Foundation and is currently touring his original solo-piece FOR PROFIT.  

About Student Debt Crisis
Student Debt Crisis is a non-profit advocacy organization that is dedicated to fundamental reforms to the way in which higher education is paid for in America. It was formed when Robert Applebaum of ForgiveStudentLoanDebt.com joined forces with Kyle McCarthy and Natalia Abrams, both fellows with the Backbone Campaign, and Aaron Calafato, who serves as the organization’s Artistic Director.

What We Need:

Each performance of FOR PROFIT costs approximately $1250.00 to stage at each University venue. 

  • 10 performances at 10 Universities = $12,500.00


All proceeds raised will be used solely to fund travel and production expenses for each performance. Such expenses include, but not limited to: venue fees and accommodations, production costs, and travel, (car rental, airfare, gas, train fare, lodging, and meals).


FOR PROFIT makes an IMPACT and so will your contribution ! 

Be a part of contributing to this nationally recognized social theatre piece which aims to influence how we fund higher education in America. 

FOR PROFIT has been featured in:  The Huffington Post;  The Chronicle; Campus Progress; RT-America; NPR; (NPR) MPBN; NPR (WYSO); WEWS ABC Channel 5; Mobilize.org; Portland Press Herald; The Fiscal Times; and Washington Monthly  

What are people saying about FOR PROFIT?

“The play blends theatrical techniques of storytelling and acting, in the tradition of the late monologist Spalding Gray”-The Chronicle of Higher Education

“This is one of those rare works that cuts right to the heart of an issue no one wants to discuss and/or deal with” - NYC Theatre Report Card

"FOR PROFIT is a timely, provocative, and daring piece of theatre that should not be missed. He creatively brings to light a true modern day scam.-Karl Bury (The Karl Bury Studio NYC)

 

Our Goals:

FOR PROFIT serves as an important creative tool in educating, informing, and creating social dialogue about the ever-growing student debt crisis.

Our goal is to curate 10 performances of FOR PROFIT at 10 different Universities around the country. This creative form of direct action is designed to engage Americans of all ages, from all walks of life, as to the perils of the ongoing student debt crisis.

How You Can Contribute:

Please donate to this campaign and SHARE SHARE SHARE it on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Email and more!!  Share with friends, family, neighbors, colleagues and co-workers, and anyone who has been affected by the student debt crisis.

story:
Nice to meet you!

We are PenShakes – the Pensacola Shakespeare Theatre. Right now, we are a small group of theatre enthusiasts with a big idea. We want to bring exceptional theatre to Northwest Florida.

Pensacola Shakespeare Theatre, or "PenShakes" as we call it sometimes, is a small group of community members looking to bring exceptional theatre to Northwest Florida. We've been together for three years, and we're hoping to continue our work for many years to come.

Here's the thing: Our small theatre needs you. While we usually ask large groups and companies to consider making larger donations; today, we ask you to consider making a humble gift. We want to help teach and train the next generation of aspiring young artists and we need your help to make it happen.

 

Indiegogo Indeed

The apprentices are an integral part of our family, and they often do not get enough credit for their hard work.

Our program gives them the chance to learn from and perform with working actors. They also help teach our summer camps. It’s all valuable professional experience. Their commitment also involves a lot of grunt work, like constructing sets, assisting with advertising, and helping make all other preparations. For all this, they are paid a very small stipend to help cover their expenses. Because our apprentices come from all over the southeast, we provide basic housing. 

We're hoping to set our apprentices up for the next level of professional accomplishment.

 

The Impact

While this is our first Indiegogo campaign, we’re hoping to make an impact for these young aspiring artists and technicians.

Your donation through this IndieGoGo campaign will make a real difference for these aspiring artists and technicians. Even though the experience they receive is invaluable, many of them couldn’t afford to take part in our program without the cash stipend we provide. Our apprentices today will become the next generation of successful performers, set designers, or theatre professors, and you will help them reach their full potential through your gift today.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes, we believe in something so much, but circumstances prevent us from opening our pockets. We understand, but we also know that you are still a valuable part of helping us build our apprenticeship project. Please tell your friends, family members, colleagues or anyone interested in the arts about our project. Visit our website and our Facebook page to get to know us, and share our sites with the people you know. Getting the word out can be just as helpful as giving. If you are in our area, we also encourage you to come see our performance, make an in-kind donation from your business, or give your time as a volunteer. Just because you can’t give cash doesn’t mean you can’t support PenShakes.

story:
My Story

In May 2010, I graduated from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts with a BFA in Dance.  Since graduation I have been working as a dancer based in New York City.  I have had the honor to work with Brian Brooks Moving Company and Doug Varone and Dancers.  Last Summer I was selected to join DanceNYC's Junior Committee.  The Junior Committee is comprised of 19 of New York City's young leaders in the dance sector, working as artists, educators and administrators.  Our aim is to strengthen and unite the dance community, serve as a catalyst for innovation and invention in the work of young professionals, and re-energize this peer group in a challenging field.


I feel the need to bring more attention to the arts, more specifically to dance.  I have applied for a writing workshop at Dance Theater Workshop, Writing on Dance with Eva Yaa Asantewaa.  Eva has been writing on dance since 1976, she has been published in Dance Magazine, The Village Voice, SoHo Weekly News, and Gay City News.  This workshop meets once a week from March 30-June 1 and is focused on exercises that consider questions such as: How do I relate and respond to dance?  Why write about dance? What is my role? and Who am I as perceiver and witness of art? 


I will use this class to explore the relationship between performance and written response; specifically how can they compliment, challenge, and strengthen each other?  After the completion of this workshop, I will share my responses to dance in an effort to build advocacy for the field and strengthen the artistic discourse.


I have been discouraged recently by the tone in which critics at the New York Times have been writing on dance, I feel it does not serve the field to ruthlessly attack the artists in these 'opinion' articles.  On the other hand, after attending a discussion with Jennifer Homan in early March, I felt inspired by the insight and attention Jennifer has brought to dance through her book 'Apollos Angels'.  We need more critical discussion of dance that doesn't discourage artists, from challenging the field, and the public, from attending and supporting artistic endeavours.

What I'm Asking For

I have been accepted into the workshop, but I am unable to afford the fee of $225.  I need to raise $252 (the $225 fee plus IndieGoGo processing fees) by Wednesday March 30.  As a recent college graduate, working as a dancer, and living in Brooklyn my finances are limited but I feel the need for change.  Any amount of assistance is greatly appreciated.


***We have exceeded the cost for this workshop. Any additional funds will serve as seed money to build advocacy for the field and strengthen the artistic discourse.


Thank you,

Hollis Bartlett

story:
MR. SATAN GOES TO WALL STREET

is a new street-theater musical comedy by the award-winning guerrilla-theater company the Imagination Liberation Front. Mr. Satan will perform this summer, outdoors in the parks of New York City – including for the Occupy Wall Street troops in Zuccotti Park – and in the streets outside of the Republican and Democratic national conventions.

IN MR. SATAN, Satan is laid off from Hell because humanity has become too adept at doing evil. To get his job back, Satan makes a deal with neoliberal economist Larry Summers to break up Occupy Wall Street. But the love between two young OWS activists might shake the Devil’s allegiance. What would Satan do? Our answer: He’d sing!

 

WHO ARE WE?

CO-AUTHORS HIERONYMOUS BANG and Sam Precario are members of the Imagination Liberation Front. BANG wrote and directed the guerrilla comedy smash “I’m Gonna Kill the President!” A Federal Offense, which played at theaters, parks, parking lots, basements, and alleys around the country for five years during Bush II. 

THE IMAGINATION LIBERATION FRONT is a guerrilla theater company in the public service. We created Mr. Satan to raise consciousness, to challenge OWS to articulate an alternative vision with mass appeal, and to turn the re-occupation of Zuccotti Park into five-star theater.We oppose violence and boredom. We wield theater as a powerful tool for social change. We mass-produce that tool through cathartic indoctrination. We also conduct guerrilla theater workshops for disadvantaged youth and other interested parties wherever we go.

BY SENDING our seven guerrilla artists on this tour, you are taking the power of creativity to the front lines of the economic justice movement. You are helping us to seize this historical moment, to use theater to tell the truth, and to demonstrate the power of imagination to solve real-world problems. Media coverage of this play – and there will be media coverage – will display the intelligence, humor, compassion, discipline and ferocity of this movement. Activists and regular citizens around the country will hear of this work and find inspiration.

 

BRASS TACKS, PLEASE

WE ARE RAISING $5,000 with this Indiegogo campaign to support our tour to the conventions, which take place in late August and early September. Our overall fundraising goal for this project is $12,000, which we are supplementing by holding big- and small-ticket benefit readings.

OUR MAIN EXPENSE IS THE TOUR. Airfare (NYC > Tampa Bay > Charlotte > NYC) for seven will cost $650 per person, totaling $4,550. Our next main cost is feeding our company. Each of us will receive a $20 per diem for meals. The tour will last for 13 days, from the day we leave for Tampa to the day we return from Charlotte. That adds up to $1,820. This campaign will cover airfare and some of our meal budget; the rest of our budget includes stipends for our amazing actors, director, music director and stage manager; costumes, props and other production essentials; and smaller tour expenses like bus fare.

HENCE, a contribution of $20 feeds one actor for a day. A contribution of $140 feeds the whole troupe for a day. A donation of $650 pays for one actor’s plane ticket, while a contribution of $910 covers one actor’s entire trip. If we fall short of our goal, we will tighten our belts accordingly. If we only make it to one convention instead of both, our voices will still be heard. If we fall extremely short of our goal, what we raise will support the New York production and a possible Los Angeles production. Finally, you may notice that accommodations are not in this budget—we are cutting costs by couch surfing with friends and strangers. Feel free to get in touch if you know of a friendly couch!

 

REWARDS!

SURE, IMAGINATION LIBERATION FRONT, this project is a great tactic in the struggle for economic equality, freedom of speech and social justice, but what’s in it for me? We also offer neat rewards for contributions! Postcards from the actors while on tour; the original cast soundtrack; songs written in your honor by the composer, plays written based on your life by the playwright; and more! Your memento will testify that you supported direct, creative action at the orgies of oligarchy in New York, Tampa Bay and Charlotte—without leaving the comfort of your computer bunker!

 

IMPACT

THIS IS A CRUCIAL TIME to act against corporate rule. Greedmongers call the shots. Our leaders are compromised or downright bad. People are struggling. Our voices are squeezed out of mainstream media. The good news is, upon quick review of human history, profound social change always starts from the grassroots level—possibly from the same parks and streets where Mr. Satan will perform. The movement is already happening. Your support brings us that much closer to success.

WE MODEL CHANGE that is creative and fun, and there’s nothing more fun than laughing, crying, singing and dancing—while occupying public space. Although this play will be performed outdoors, during demonstrations and other events, it will be executed with artistic precision and panache. A well-crafted, quality work of theater sends the message that our movement is not one of slovenly slackers but of focused, committed visionaries.

 

OUR TRACK RECORD

THE ILF’S first show, “I’m Gonna Kill the President!” A Federal Offense, achieved national notoriety and ran for five years all around the U.S. It performed in ten states, in well known venues like PS122 in New York and Highways in L.A., as well as in parks, parking lots, basements, warehouses, alleys, community centers and living rooms. President! wormed its way into mainstream media like Fox News, the Wall Street Journal, the New York Times, the New York Post, and countless more. The show received an L.A. Weekly Award for Special Achievement in 2006 and went to the Spoleto Festival in South Carolina in 2007.

MUCH OF THE RUN OF PRESIDENT! was conducted guerrilla-style, out of a van, adapting to a variety of environments. That experience will come in handy on our tour. We have designed Mr. Satan to be light and easy—minimal props and costumes, no set pieces or technical gear. As producers of guerrilla theater work as well as “regular” theater, we know how to come in on budget. We have extensive connections throughout Occupy, as well as in activist, media, social and theatrical networks, and have support in every city we will visit.

 

MORE WAYS TO SUPPORT

BUT! If the heart leads where the wallet cannot follow, you can still support us in important ways:

Spread the word about this campaign. Use our Facebook link, or send people to this site. Check out the Indiegogo share tools on this page. Also visit our blog at http://mrsatangoestowallstreet.blogspot.com/ for updates and performance information.

Spread the word about this show. That is how grass roots grow. Know anyone in New York City, Tampa Bay, or Charlotte? Send them to the show! And ask if they’d like to house some of us for a night! We are clean, polite, and extremely entertaining.

THANK YOU for your support! All hail Mr. Satan!

THIS IS A CRUCIAL TIME to act against corporate rule. Greedmongers call the shots. Our leaders are compromised or downright bad. People are struggling. Our voices are squeezed out of mainstream media. The good news is, upon quick review of human history, profound social change always starts from the grassroots level—possibly from the same parks and streets where Mr. Satan will perform. The movement is already happening. Your support brings us that much closer to success.
WE MODEL CHANGE that is creative and fun, and there’s nothing more fun than laughing, crying, singing and dancing—while occupying public space. Although this play will be performed outdoors, during demonstrations and other events, it will be executed with artistic precision and panache. A well-crafted, quality work of theater sends the message that our movement is not one of slovenly slackers but of focused, committed visionaries.
 
OUR TRACK RECORD
THE ILF’S first show, “I’m Gonna Kill the President!” A Federal Offense, achieved national notoriety and ran for five years all around the U.S. It performed in ten states, in well known venues like PS122 in New York and Highways in L.A., as well as in parks, parking lots, basements, warehouses, alleys, community centers and living rooms. President! wormed its way into mainstream media like Fox News, the Wall Street Journal, the New York Times, the New York Post, and countless more. The show received an L.A. Weekly Award for Special Achievement in 2006 and went to the Spoleto Festival in South Carolina in 2007.
MUCH OF THE RUN OF PRESIDENT! was conducted guerrilla-style, out of a van, adapting to a variety of environments. That experience will come in handy on our tour. We have designed Mr. Satan to be light and easy—minimal props and costumes, no set pieces or technical gear. As producers of guerrilla theater work as well as “regular” theater, we know how to come in on budget. We have extensive connections throughout Occupy, as well as in activist, media, social and theatrical networks, and have support in every city we will visit.
 
MORE WAYS TO SUPPORT
BUT! If the heart leads where the wallet cannot follow, you can still support us in important ways:
Spread the word about this campaign. Use our Facebook link, or send people to this site. Check out the Indiegogo share tools on this page. Also visit our blog at http://mrsatangoestowallstreet.blogspot.com/ for updates and performance information.
Spread the word about this show. That is how grass roots grow. Know anyone in New York City, Tampa Bay, or Charlotte? Send them to the show! And ask if they’d like to house some of us for a night! We are clean, polite, and extremely entertaining.
THANK YOU for your support! All hail Mr. Satan!

story:
Our Story

The Bower Group is an NYC theater company formed by members of the 2011 Atlantic Acting School graduating class.  In May we staged our first full-length production, "Eurydice" by Sarah Ruhl at Atlantic's Stage 2.  Now, come August 30th, The Bower Group will make their off-off-Broadway debut with "This is For You," an evening of original work written by company members Brittany Crowell, Mara Measor, Zach Szofer, and Connor Unger.  Directed by company member Jon Cicoski, "This is For You" is a show that celebrates the power of memory, evaluating how we make the most of the moments we have with the people closest to us.   This is a show a born entirely from the hearts and minds of The Bower Group, and with your help and generous donation, We will make "This is For You" a reality.

 

"This is For You," an evening of original work

Written by Brittany Crowell, Mara Measor, Zach Szofer, and Connor Unger

Directed by Jon Cicoski

Produced by Brittany Crowell

 

Featuring Justin Danforth, Chris Davis, Jess Loudon, Rachel Lyle, Dan Tepper, and Jamie Wolfe

 

Set/Props Design: Ellie Johnson

Costume Design: Jamie Bock

Lighting Design: Erik Olson

Sound Design: Ryan Ettinger

Original Music by: Ryan Ettinger, Mara Measor, Dan Tepper

The Impact

In order for "This is For You" to occur, we need your help!  There is still a long way to go in funding the show.  We have to pay for theater rental fees, props, set pieces, costumes, sound equipment, transportation for the technical elements of the show.  Without this campaign, we won't be able to afford these important aspects of the show.  This is where you come in!

What We Need & What You Get

Though we've had a successful couple fundraising events (concerts, parties, etc.) we still have a long way to go before we meet our goal for this show.  Here's what we're looking for:

 

Theater Rental Fee--$1250

Show Budget (costumes, set, lighting, music, etc.)--$1000

Publicity (postcards, posters, ticket sales)--$500

 

Though we're looking for $2,750 for this specific production, The Bower Group has many workshops, cabarets, readings, full-length productions, and other ventures planned for the fall of 2011 and the spring of 2012.  Any additional funds raised will go towards these exciting projects.

story:
Our Story

Elixir Productions Theatre Company was founded in 1998 by a group of scrappy theatre majors in college who literally wanted to make a name for themselves. Because we wanted our shows to be taken seriously, and because all serious theatre companies have names, we decided to call ourselves “Elixir Productions” after the kind of theatre we wanted to make: magical, restorative, weird and beautiful.


In the 10-plus years since our college days, Elixir has thrived as an independent theatre company dedicated to producing original work by our Resident Playwright (Alex DeFazio, M.F.A. Columbia University, finalist for the Princess Grace Playwriting Award), under the direction of our Resident Director (Jody P. Person, M.F.A. Rutgers University/Mason Gross School of the Arts), and featuring an extremely talented and dedicated company of actors.


Made from equal parts tradition and experimentation, our company continues to dig for magic. At the same time, we have also grown to take on the larger mission of creating uniquely queer performances that explore subversive forms of desire.


The World-Premiere Play

Part gay noir and part meditation on memory and loss, our upcoming production, 2 Burn, centers on the relationship between Paul, a professor of English and theory, and Manny, an ambitious but struggling college student. Fresh from a bad breakup and stymied by writer’s block, Paul turns to Manny for validation and companionship, becoming his lover as well as his tutor. Manny devours Paul’s teachings, intent on mastering the power of words. But Manny has a secret, and its discovery ultimately leads both men to battle for control over language, sex, and each other.


The Impact

Elixir Productions is a frugal little company; we keep costs low so that we can focus first on making great theatre and not on how we are going to pay for it. That said, our expenses, though small, still need to be paid.


Your tax-deductible donation will ensure that 2 Burn has a stellar, debt-free run at next month’s New York International Fringe Festival (August 12-28, 2011). While the benefits of donating to established non-profits may be obvious, consider the importance of giving to lesser-known companies like ours. The future of theatre depends on up-and-coming voices being heard, and nowhere would your donation be more lasting than in building the next generation of theatre artists.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $3580 towards our world-premiere production of 2 Burn at the New York International Fringe Festival. The amount breaks down as follows: $800 for Fringe fees, $200 for press mailings, $680 for advertising, $300 for marketing, and one $200 stipend each for the eight members of the cast and core production team (actors, directors, playwright, and stage manager). These stipends will cover actors’ and team members’ travel (to and from rehearsals, which began in early June, as well as to and from performances).


Here's what you get:

  • $10  → A front-page shout-out on our website and a "thank you" on our Facebook page
  • $25  → The above, plus an acknowledgement in our playbill
  • $50  → An acknowledgement in our playbill, plus a ticket for the show held for you at the door (your choice of date)
  • $100 → The above, plus another ticket (two tickets total for any one performance of your choice)
  • $150 → An acknowledgement in our playbill, two tickets, and a copy of the manuscript signed by the cast, playwright, and directors
  • $200 → The above, plus an 8.5 x 11 framed photograph from the production signed by photographer Robert A. Terrano
  • $250 → The above, plus a video from a member of the cast or artistic staff, posted to our website, personally thanking you for your donation


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come see 2 Burn at the New York International Fringe Festival!
  • Purchase tickets in advance, starting July 22, online at www.fringenyc.org or by phone at 1-866-468-7619. Buying your tickets in advance is especially helpful since it sells out performances and drives up the buzz about our show!
  • If you’re a Facebooker, a Twitterer, or a blogger — or if you’re on any other social media sites — post a message telling everyone how excited you are about the world premiere of 2 Burn! Include a link to our website in your message: www.elixirproductions.org.
  • “Like” our company’s Facebook page.
  • RSVP to our Facebook invitation for 2 Burn.
  • If you live in NY/NJ, e-mail your address to info@elixirproductions.org and we'll mail you a stack of 2 Burn postcards for you to distribute as you please.
  • If you can think of other ways to help, e-mail us at info@elixirproductions.org and let us know! We’d be thrilled to hear from you!

story:
Who the Hell Do You Think You Are?

Hello friends and lovers.  Thanks for visiting my solo show touring campaign.  If you are here, you most likely know me or my work, but just to catch us all up to speed: 


My name is Desiree Burch.  For the past ten years, I have been a performance artist, educator and vibrant part of the Downtown theater community of New York.  I am a graduate of Yale University, and since 2001, have created personal, funny, compelling and daring work for theaters, comedy clubs, museums, schools and out of doors around NYC, the USA and more recently, the UK. 

Isaac Byrne is my director, collaborator and friend.  He is the former Artistic Director of the NYIT and GLAAD Award-winning theater company, Working Man's Clothes, as well as a teacher of acting technique at the New York Film Academy. We began working together 4 years ago, in the early stages of 52 Man Pickup, helping to transform it from raw and raunchy stories pulled out of a hat into a deeply transformational experience for both artist and audience, with all of its dirty diamonds still gleaming.

52 Man Pickup is a show we have made together.  It is a sex-positive theater and comedy piece that comes from authentic and personal experiences, bridging sexuality, race, identity, religion, feminism

What the Hell Are You Doing?

Since collaborating on theatrical performances at The Tank and Ars Nova, we have played venerable venues like The Ohio Theatre, Joe's Pub and 59E59, and have taken the work to Hollywood, New Orleans, England and Scotland.  We have also created a new work, Tar Baby--the premiere of which many of you witnessed in the soloNOVA Festival this May. 

This August we will be taking the show to the Edinburgh Festival Fringe, the original fringe, and the largest open arts festival in the world.  This will be a return to the Fringe for 52 Man Pickup, having been part of the Free Festival in 2009.  This time around though, we are going not just for the experience, but to take advantage of the opportunities there. 

Like NYC, Edinburgh is an over-saturated market, but also a place where quality work can rise to the top in grand fashion--gaining opportunities for booking and representation.  It's essentially an arts conference, and this year we are going with the Festival's hottest new theatrical hub:  The Hill Street Theatre.  We are also securing PR assistance in fighting the uphill battle of getting behinds in seats, so that the magic can all happen.

We have a tried and tested product, and the presentation and production required to really make the most out if the experience. I wouldn't be going back if I didn't think that it was worth all the money and effort put into it to really be seen. 

Who the Hell Cares?

Well, here's the benefit to me--

This production does have the ability to change my life as a solo performer.  It can set the stage for my work in the international arena, and provide more opportunities for 52 Man Pickup, and Tar Baby, as well as future shows that I create.  It also opens me up to the world of agents and producers for television as well as theater. It assures that my voice gets out there in the way that not only I, but many of you, think it should.


And here's the benefit to everyone else--

The main reason I continue to do this show, after almost 5 years of performing it, is that, each time I do, someone, male or female, comes up to me after the show to tell me their very personal story.  They talk about how this show speaks to their experience, and how they'd felt like the were alone until they heard me tell my story.  I can see how powerful that validation and recognition is to them--it's as important as theirs is to me.  And this is, in fact, what theater is for.  This show has the opportunity to reach people in different corners of the universe, to educate as well as entertain, and to instill a stronger sense of empathy, self confidence and self worth in all who experience it.  I really believe that.  I have seen it happen.  And I really do like to think that people who have experienced this worth with me are better (to themselves and others) for it.


And aside from the personal impact the show may have, it definitely has an impact in making theater more relevant, accessible and important to people than it sometimes feels.  Whether you've seen a lot or a little of it, this show always makes for memorable theater, as it is a memorable experience.

What the Hell Do You Want, and What the Hell Do I Get Out of This?

We are setting our fundraising goals high but attainable.  We are seeking to raise 10,000 by July 22, 2011.


That sounds crazy, you say?  Well, if everyone who in this intimate circle of friends and supporters were to give $10 or $20, we would have more than enough.  I know, crazy right? 


The beautiful thing is that, in the course of the past 10, or really, 14 years that I have lived on the East Coast and been a dedicated performer, I have met thousands of like minded artists, activists, dreamers, thinkers, and moreover, just good people.  Like yourself.  And I know that many of you believe in what I have to say to the world and getting it out there.  All I am asking of you is to put a little bit of money - a cocktail or two's worth of money - where your mouth is.  And some of you can afford to, and would like to do a lot more, and I would love to give you that opportunity ;-)

The majority of the money will go to paying the rent at our theater (about $4200), and securing PR representation for the show (about $3000).  The remainder of that will go towards Marketing (posters, flyers, etc.) a few more production elements of the show (sets & costumes), taxes, fees, etc., and of course, flights and lodging.  

What you can get, are some really great prizes and perks, including: 
  • a live performance of the show for your private party or event.
  • a host for your next performance, corporate event, etc.
  • private coaching sessions on writing (creative/speechwriting/academic), solo performance, public speaking, acting by Desiree or Isaac.
  • a personalized novelty "card" in the deck - where I speak poetically about our fictitious midnight meeting.
  • a private dinner or brunch created and hosted by Desiree
  • And MORE!!!

How the Hell Can I Help?

Once you have made your donation, or if you cannot, you can share this information with others you think would be interested.  These people include: People who know/love Desiree Burch, people who love solo performance, and the transformative power of theater.

story:
Hello I am Mysterion, longtime Canadian variety entertainer and burlesque producer. I am the founder of the Canadian burlesque hall of Fame as well as the producer of the longest running community burlesque stage. My mind reading show has been a local draw for almost a decade and what I make, I put back into the scene by raising the bar and making the events bigger and better. 
 
My goal for the past decade was to create an environment that allows performers to have a stage to work on, learn and benefit from the network  have built and thus get bigger themselves faster. After building and creating so many local performers and working with so many newcomers, I've been asked to be a guest and judge in the first annual Japanese burlesque talent show. Strip Search Tokyo.   
 
Burlesque is an art form and rarely does a show make a huge profit, alot of the performers do it for the thrill of the act. Seeing this is a first time event, I have to get myself over there. This will give me an opportunity to experience burlesque from another culture, LIVE and bring that back to Canada. It will also provide a young scene in Japan a veteran teacher and experienced judge who can bring them knowledge and insight to their community. 
 
The shows Ive done in Toronto have been for the benefit of the young performers to get seen and get on bigger shows. Having me in Japan only brings credibility to the Toronto shows, while allowing our Japanese counterparts the opportunity to have a Canadian perspective at their event. 

What We Need 

I will need $3000 Canadian dollars to make this trip happen. This will cover my airfare, lodging, food and ground transportation. I work on a tight budget and plan to donate my time to the show on a drastically reduced rate, practically free. All flood money will go directly back into Strip search Tokyo to cover the costs of their needs if applicable.
 
The funds always will go towards the goal, I will additionally be producing a LIVE fundraier for proceeds as well as this indigogo. 
 

The Impact

My track record in the industry is one of the most successful while working on a grassroots budget. I have grown to producing the largest burlesque shows in the country, all from my pocket and all very successful. I have organized fundraisers for the Toronto Burlesque Festival, Co produce the TBF as well as founded the Great Canadian Burlesque Academy: A dance school for young and veterans alike to build and learn. From my own hard work I have networked to performers around the globe and brought them to Canada for the purpose to build our scene and allows others to learn from them and be inspired. My starting of the Canadian Hall of Fame was to recognize the contributions of the performers who have come before us while nourishing the present and building a future. 

 

About the event Mysterion will be attending in Japan!

"C'est magnifique is a very unique showcase, including variety and diversity in 'Burlesque'.  From young bees to well-oiled stage personas, from East to West, this showcase includes all that is burlesque, such as dance, song, vaudeville, sketch-comedy, magic, and more! This special showcase is also a place to search out the rising stars of burlesque. The guest judges will encourage the young stars, by giving the wisdom, tips, or the opportunity for performance!" - Cherry Typhoon, Japanese award winning burlesque artist.

Venue : Shinsekai 
Mihotani Glass Building B1 
1-8-4 Nishiazabu Minato-city Tokyo Japan
Tel:03-5772-6767  Fax:03-5772-6797
http://shinsekai9.jp
story_txt:
Hello I am Mysterion, longtime Canadian variety entertainer and burlesque producer. I am the founder of the Canadian burlesque hall of Fame as well as the producer of the longest running community burlesque stage. My mind reading show has been a local draw for almost a decade and what I make, I put back into the scene by raising the bar and making the events bigger and better. 
 
My goal for the past decade was to create an environment that allows performers to have a stage to work on, learn and benefit from the network  have built and thus get bigger themselves faster. After building and creating so many local performers and working with so many newcomers, I've been asked to be a guest and judge in the first annual Japanese burlesque talent show. Strip Search Tokyo.   
 
Burlesque is an art form and rarely does a show make a huge profit, alot of the performers do it for the thrill of the act. Seeing this is a first time event, I have to get myself over there. This will give me an opportunity to experience burlesque from another culture, LIVE and bring that back to Canada. It will also provide a young scene in Japan a veteran teacher and experienced judge who can bring them knowledge and insight to their community. 
 
The shows Ive done in Toronto have been for the benefit of the young performers to get seen and get on bigger shows. Having me in Japan only brings credibility to the Toronto shows, while allowing our Japanese counterparts the opportunity to have a Canadian perspective at their event. 



What We Need 


I will need $3000 Canadian dollars to make this trip happen. This will cover my airfare, lodging, food and ground transportation. I work on a tight budget and plan to donate my time to the show on a drastically reduced rate, practically free. All flood money will go directly back into Strip search Tokyo to cover the costs of their needs if applicable.
 
The funds always will go towards the goal, I will additionally be producing a LIVE fundraier for proceeds as well as this indigogo. 
 



The Impact

My track record in the industry is one of the most successful while working on a grassroots budget. I have grown to producing the largest burlesque shows in the country, all from my pocket and all very successful. I have organized fundraisers for the Toronto Burlesque Festival, Co produce the TBF as well as founded the Great Canadian Burlesque Academy: A dance school for young and veterans alike to build and learn. From my own hard work I have networked to performers around the globe and brought them to Canada for the purpose to build our scene and allows others to learn from them and be inspired. My starting of the Canadian Hall of Fame was to recognize the contributions of the performers who have come before us while nourishing the present and building a future. 

 
About the event Mysterion will be attending in Japan!
"C'est magnifique is a very unique showcase, including variety and diversity in 'Burlesque'.  From young bees to well-oiled stage personas, from East to West, this showcase includes all that is burlesque, such as dance, song, vaudeville, sketch-comedy, magic, and more! This special showcase is also a place to search out the rising stars of burlesque. The guest judges will encourage the young stars, by giving the wisdom, tips, or the opportunity for performance!" - Cherry Typhoon, Japanese award winning burlesque artist.
Venue : Shinsekai Mihotani Glass Building B1 1-8-4 Nishiazabu Minato-city Tokyo JapanTel:03-5772-6767  Fax:03-5772-6797http://shinsekai9.jp

story:
STRANDED

a new play by Fiona Lakeland - directed by Adrian LaTourelle 

Inspired by journals and writings of SYLVIA PLATH and MARILYN MONROE - from a collaboration with Kimberly Connolly

  • Exploring: "How does sexual abuse affect mental health?"

For Tickets and Show info visit our "Hollywood Fringe Festival" page!

Check us out on Facebook!

  • WHEN: Monday 6/10 @ 8pm, Tuesday 6/11 @ 8:15pm, Tuesdays 6/18, 6/25 @ 8pm, Wednesdays 6/19, 6/26 @ 10:30pm, and Saturday Nights 6/15, 6/22 @ 12:05am.
  • WHERE: Theatre of NOTE – 1517 N. Cahuenga Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90028

Thank you for considering being a co-producer for our show!

 

About the Show 

"The story is about Annabelle and Lucy who are two personalities, of perhaps many personalities, that are inhabiting one body. In the beginning of the play, they're really not able to connect at all. However, by the end, how each of them deal with the abuse is what inevitably allows them to come together in the end."

There is something very haunting about both Sylvia and Marilyn who, each in their own way, hid behind a public mask, and only through their writings were they able to release some of their darkest demons. 

  • Did these demons inevitably lead to their suicides?
  • Does death of choice lead to a different place than death of natural cause?
  • What, then, is this “middle distance” when, perhaps, your heart and soul separate from your body? And then how do they get back to it.

The Process

The one thing that's remained constant in all of the drafts is that there was this sexual abuse. A lot of that comes from Marilyn Monroe's writings. Her Aunt Ida being the one who abused her when she was a child.

  • Victims of this sexual abuse who are stuck in these situations, most of the time are either in denial of the abuse, or they don't know how to get out of it, or they're too afraid to try.
  • Predators come in all different shapes and sizes, and it could be the person you least expect it to be.

Thoughts on Marilyn Monroe and Sylvia Plath:

  • Marilyn, when you look at her writing, she was really very unhappy and very disturbed.
  • With Sylvia Plath, I've always been drawn to "What does it mean to be mentally unstable?"

Writing My Own Piece

What I love about writing my own piece is that literally anything is possible. I have the freedom to create whatever I want to create.

  • We really wanted to do this play, inspired by these writings, for the Hollywood Fringe Festival this year! And we can't wait to share it with all of you!

 

We Need Your Help!

To make this happen, we need to raise $1,360! We've outlined, exactly where your money will go below!

  • Theatre Rental and Insurance: $385
  • Registration Fee: $250
  • Postcards / Posters / Programs / Scripts: $150
  • Press releases / Publicity / Online Presence: $300
  • Costumes / Props: $150
  • Photos / Video: $125

For all of our great perks, please take a look on  the right! 

  • All donors of $25 or more will receive a printed book of all of the inspiration used to write STRANDED! 

Thank you so much for believeing in us, and thank you for your donation!

*Your donation will go solely to the producing of our show, and will not be used as monetary gain for the actors, or anyone involved in the production. 

Other Monetary Gift Amounts

If you do not see an appropriate gift option for you on the right, here are some other options to choose from!

  • Would you like to donate an amount of your choosing?
  • Would you like to donate without claiming your perk?
  • Would you prefer to donate anonymously?
These options are all available on the contribution page (clicking on any perk to the right will forward you to that screen). Thank you for your donation!

Other Ways You Can Help

If it's not in your budget to help us out financially, here's some other ways you can still help us get the word out about our show!
  • Tell everyone you know!
  • Talk about it, Blog about it, Tweet about it!
  • Facebook, Twitter, and Google+ are all great ways to share online and it's so easy! Just use the share tools below!
  • And if you're even more amazing than that, we'd be happy to get you some postcards to give to all your friends, family, and loved ones! (Even strangers!)

And that's all there is to it! We look forward to seeing you at Theatre of NOTE in June for the World Premiere of STRANDED!

 

More on the Team

FIONA LAKELAND

  

(Actor/Writer/Creator)

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3739131/

After graduating from The Pacific Conservatory of the Performing Arts, Fiona Lakeland moved to Los Angeles where she continued her acting training with Sondra Kerr Blake. She has acted in various short films and plays, and currently studies with Adrian LaTourelle and Pamela Daly at Gregory Berger-Sobeck/Berg Studios.

Fiona is also a member of the Antaeus Academy with the Antaeus Company where she has studied with John Achorn and Geoffrey Wade. She was most recently seen in their production of Mrs. Warren’s Profession, directed by Robin Larsen.

Originally from Davis, CA, Fiona speaks both English and German as she spent much of her childhood splitting time between Northern California and North-Western Germany. She has been in Los Angeles since November 2008.

KIMBERLY CONNOLLY

(Actor/Creator)

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5476056/

Kimberly Connolly has been performing in theatre productions since the age of 13. Raised in Port Saint Lucie, Florida, she first stepped foot onstage at Indian River State College where she also performed in musical theatre. After high school, she studied in New York at the New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts.

Since recently moving to Los Angeles in order to pursue film, Kimberly has studied Meisner at the Elizabeth Mestnik Acting studio, and is currently taking classes at Gregory Berger Sobeck/Berg Studios under Adrian LaTourelle and Pamela Daly.

Her favorite stage credits include Laurey in “Oklahoma!” and Shelby in “Steel Magnolias.”

ADRIAN LATOURELLE

(Director/Creator)

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0490347/

Adrian LaTourelle's many stage credits include work in some of the best theaters in the country, such as the Mark Taper Forum, the Shakespeare Theater in DC, The Old globe, the San Jose Rep, the Dallas Theater Center, the Antaeus Company, and the Yale Repertory Theater.  Adrian has also worked abroad, performing in theater and film in Russia and the Netherlands.

Adrian has appeared in numerous television series such as Castle, Last Resort, The Closer, House, NCIS:LA, Boston Legal, Without a Trace, Criminal Minds, Numbers, with a recurring role on Sons of Anarchy. Adrian is also an accomplished voice over actor and recently completed season two as the voice of the evil Unalaq on Nickelodeon's Avatar: Legend of Korra.

Adrian is a graduate of the Yale School of Drama.

 

We are so excited to bring STRANDED to Theatre of NOTE for the Hollywood Fringe Festival this year! We look forward to seeing you all there!

“Kim and I, we just get each other artistically, and it’s rare that you find that with another actor on such a deep level.” says Fiona, “Ironically, our first experience working together was in an acting class working on a scene from John Patrick Shanley’s “Four Dogs and a Bone” playing two rivalrous actresses each trying to tear the other one down. But we are just the opposite of that. We have an incredible passion, love, and respect for each other’s work.”

story:
What is Dahmer?

This piece is a physical exploration of the 1990’s infamous life of Jeffrey Dahmer. Homosexual, cannibal, serial killer, and alcoholic are just a few of the adjectives immediately attached with Jeffrey’s memory. As an ensemble we have extensively researched his life based off of biography’s and interviews available to us. Using this research, we have individually drawn parallels in our own lives and used that to create this very human journey through 7 poignant moments in Dahmers life. With original pre-recorded composition, and a purpose of approaching this mans life at an un-biased point of view, we have developed a strong, risky piece of physical theater that allows the audience to draw parallels to their own lives and possibly understand what point of view Jeffery lived his own life from, without disregarding his obvious wrong-doings and keeping the respect for his victims in mind. We are simply taking a media monster and returning him to his human form.

Where will the money be going?

Most of the funds we raise will be used toward travel expenses! I have been accepted for the Hollywood Fringe festival and intend on participating in other festivals overseas. However, other expenses include...

  • Costumes
  • Props
  • Renting the performance venues
  • Festival entrance fees
  • Advertizing/programs

The Impact

Our goal is to find and expose the humanity behind the man that the world knows as "Jeffrey Dahmer the serial killer," while at the same time maintaining the respect for the victims and their families.

story:
EDGES

by

Benj Pasek & Justin Paul

 

WITH (in alphabetical order):

LIZ BUZBEE

CHAS CONACHER

MARISSA DUBOWY

TYLER ELLIS

TAYLOR KASS

CARSON KLASNER

MAXINE PHOENIX

PATRICK WALLACE

 

Directed by ANNIKA ELLWANGER-CHAVEZ & TAUBERT NADALINI

Musical Direction by SASHA BARTOL & HARRISON POE

Lighting Design by RUBY O'BRIEN

Sound Design by ETHAN ZEITMAN

Stage Managed by JAMIE SALINGER

Produced by SEAN SOPER

 

Joyce J. Cammilleri Hall

at the Brain and Creativity Institute

Friday, April 21 at 10:30 PM

Saturday, April 22 at 7:30 PM

Saturday, April 22 at 10:30 PM

WHO ARE WE?

MUSICAL THEATRE REPERTORY at USC

Musical Theatre Repertory at the University of Southern California was established in 2005 and is dedicated to enriching students’ lives through the production of quality musical theatre. Our goal is to provide students with the opportunity to participate in musical theatre pieces supplementary to those produced by USC. Find us online at www.uscmtr.com for information about the company, ticketing details, upcoming events, production stills, and even a few production videos! Thank you for supporting the arts and we can't wait to see you at our upcoming shows!

What We Need:

MTR is run exclusively by USC students. We receive no outside support from faculty or professional companies. Since our company is entirely student-run, each one of us puts in an enormous amount of time and effort to bring our productions to the stage. That being said, our financial resources are limited and our student production designers rely on the support of our donors to bring their designs to life.  Funds we raise will be used for lighting, sound, and royalties. These key elements are vital not only in helping our production reach its full potential but also in providing design students with valuable production opportunities!

The Impact:

This campaign will drastically increase the caliber of our performance! We are so grateful for all the support we have received in the past. MTR has been producing musicals for and by the students for two decades now. If you would like to see production stills from previous performances, check out our website. 

Why EDGES?

From the exciting new musical duo behind Broadway's latest hit Dear Evan Hansen and the lyricists for the Academy Award-winning La La Land, Pasek and Paul's first musical EDGES, written while the pair were undergraduate students themselves, is a beautiful song cycle musical about a group of young adults exploring their daily lives and the various relationships within them. With a riveting score that will make you laugh as hard as you will cry, EDGES will be just as relatable to USC audiences as it was when it premiered on campus at the University of Michigan over a decade ago.

Other ways to help! 

Want to tell a cast member to "break a leg"? Are you a company looking to promote your own event? You've come to the right place! We are currently selling advertising space in our program that will be distributed at every performance. Contact Sean Soper, ssoper@usc.edu, to find out more!

Whether you can offer financial support or not, please join us in the Joyce J. Cammilleri Hall at the Brain and Creativity Institute at USC on Friday, April 21 at 10:30 PM & Saturday, April 22 at 7:30 PM and 10:30 PM. We look forward to seeing you!

Another great, free way to show your support for us is by simply spreading the word. Please share this page and find us on Facebook (MUSICAL THEATRE REPERTORY AT USC).

We are always interested in getting more students involved in MTR. If you have any interest in joining our team, working on one of our shows, or getting some more information, email us at uscmtr@gmail.com and visit our website at www.uscmtr.com. We would love to hear from you! 

Thank you for supporting Musical Theatre Repertory!

We are also very thankful for the support of the USC Undergraduate Student Government.
